author: globo.com
title: TechTudo lança manual gratuito para público 60+ entender funções do WhatsApp
text:
Já sentiu dificuldade de mexer no WhatsApp? Esse aplicativo de troca de mensagens instantâneas faz parte do dia a dia de diversas pessoas, mas muitas não dominam todas as suas funções. Visando descomplicar informações fundamentais para o manuseio do mensageiro do Meta, a redação do TechTudo, da Editora Globo, lançou o e-book Guia do WhatsApp: o Manual Descomplicado Sobre o App .
Continuar lendo O guia está disponível em PDF e você pode fazer o download grátis. Para ter acesso ao conteúdo, basta clicar aqui . O e-book faz parte do projeto Tech60+, um projeto da TechTudo que vista dar mais autonomia aos idosos quando o assunto é tecnologia, promovendo a inclusão digital.
Siga a Quem nas redes : Instagram
Tiktok
WhatsApp
A ideia é que o material gratuito seja compartilhado pelos usuários dentro do próprio WhatsApp e também por outros aplicativos de mensagens e redes sociais. Vale destacar que, além dar uma introdução sobre os principais recursos e símbolos do WhatsApp, o manual também conta com explicações sobre os golpes mais comuns que acontecem no app.
O guia é dividido em cinco capítulos, sendo eles:
Parte 1: Conheça os principais recursos do WhatsApp Parte 2: Os golpes mais comuns do WhatsApp Parte 3: WhatsApp clonado: o que é, como descobrir se você foi vítima e o que fazer Parte 4: O que você precisa fazer para não em golpes Parte 5: Como deixar o WhatsApp protegido?
Guia do WhatsApp do TechTudo — Foto: Reprodução/TechTudo Mais lidas da semana CASA E JARDIM: Duda Reis mostra cômodo onde será o quarto da filha e revela tema da decoração QUEM: Furacão Milton: Anitta tranquiliza família após decidir não sair de Miami CRESCER: Menino revela pedido de aniversário e leva a mãe às lágrimas MARIE CLAIRE: Menos de dois minutos: mulher viraliza ao contar a história do 'date mais rápido de todos os tempos' Mais recente Próxima Zayn lamenta morte de Liam Payne, ex-colega de One Direction: 'Te admirava'

author: Stephen Sorace
title: Hiker lost for 10 days found alive in Northern California mountains
text: A hiker who got lost in the mountains of Northern California for over a week was found alive on Thursday after witnesses heard his cries for help, authorities said. Lukas McClish, 34, disappeared on June 11 after setting off on a hike in Boulder Creek, the Santa Cruz County Sheriff’s Office said. He was found yelling for help 10 days later in a remote canyon in Big Basin State Park. McClish told KGO-TV that he had left his home in Boulder Creek with few supplies, believing he was only going for a three-hour hike before getting lost in the Santa Cruz Mountains. I left with just a pair of pants, and my pair of hiking shoes, and a hat. I had a flashlight, and a pair of folding scissors, like a Leatherman tool. And that was about it," McClish told KGO-TV. CALIFORNIA COUPLE'S BODIES RECOVERED FROM WATERFALL NEAR YOSEMITE: ‘THEY WERE IMPORTANT’ McClish was reported missing five days later after he failed to show up to a family gathering on Father’s Day, KSWB-TV reported. The 34-year-old told KSWB that he survived 10 days lost in the wild by drinking water from creeks and waterfalls out of his boot, eating wild berries and sleeping on a bed of wet leaves. All the while, he yelled for help in the hopes of being rescued. McClish’s calls went unanswered until Thursday, when the sheriff’s office said multiple witnesses reported hearing someone yelling for help in Big Basin State Park. The sheriff’s office launched a drone to establish the exact location of the voice, and spotted McClish in the forest between Empire Grade and Big Basin Highway near Foreman Creek. CALIFORNIA HIKERS RESCUED AFTER RUNNING OUT OF WATER DURING BLISTERING HEAT WAVE McClish had no major injuries, according to the sheriff's office, and he was reunited with his family. Officials shared photos of a ragged McClish hugging family in the woods. McClish said he’s had enough of the outdoors for a while. "I did enough hiking for probably the whole rest of the year," he told KGO-TV. Multiple agencies assisted the sheriff’s office in the rescue effort, including CAL Fire CZU, Boulder Creek Volunteer Fire Department, California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation and California State Parks. Original article source:

author: @TIMESNOW
title: India's 'BIG' Defence Move! Fifth-Generation Fighter AMCA Project Gets CCS Nod | Nation Tonight | Shows News, Times Now
text: India's 'BIG' Defence Move! Fifth-Generation Fighter AMCA Project Gets CCS Nod | Nation Tonight In this episode of Nation Tonight, anchor Shreya Upadhyaya will discuss how the project to design and construct India's fifth-generation fighter jet, the Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA), has received approval from the Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS). India will join a restricted club of countries that have produced fifth-generation fighters tanks to the AMCA. These kinds of sophisticated aircraft are exclusive to the US, China, and Russia. The project, which is managed by the DRDO's Aeronautical Development Agency (ADA), will produce the aircraft prototypes. Hindustan Aeronautics Limited will serve as the manufacturing agency. We are joined by a few panelists expressing their views on this issue. "Its a very important milestone in history of fighter aircraft development in the country, I express my gratitude to DRDO, govt of India to launch a major timely initiative...": Former DG DRDO, Dr. W. Selvamurthy. Listen In!#india #military #combat #aircraft #cabinetcommitteeonsecurity #ccs #drdo #aeronautical #aeronautics #fightertanks #indianews #mirrornowshow #nationtonight #shreyaupadhyaya
